north carolina department of transportation raleigh standard specifications for roads and structures january num foreword this publication has been prepared to provide a compilation of standard requirements used by the north carolina department of transportation for construction contracts .
when this publication entitled standard specifications for roads and structures dated january num is incorporated by reference into the departments construction bid proposals or contracts it is made a part of that document and shall be known as the standard specifications .
the requirements stated herein may be revised or amended from time to time by supplemental specifications by standard special provisions which are unique to a select group of projects or by project special provisions which are unique to the specific bid proposal or contract .
working titles have a masculine gender such as workman workmen and foreman .
pronouns such as he his and him are used in the standard specifications for the sake of brevity and are intended to refer to persons of either sex or corporate entities .
reference by title and date will be made to the governing provisions on plans and contract documents .
general information for general questions about this publication please contact the contract standards and development unit at specsncdot.gov or num num .
ordering information copies of the standard specifications and the roadway standard drawings may be purchased through the contract standards and development unit north carolina department of transportation contract standards and development unit manual distribution num mail service center raleigh nc num telephone num num website httpwww.ncdot.gov the order form is available at httpwww.ncdot.govbusinessorderpuborder.html .
electronic copies of the standard specifications and the roadway standard drawings are available for download on the contract standards and development units website at httpsconnect.ncdot.govresourcesspecificationspagesdefault.aspx .

num additional work additional work is that which results from a change or alteration to num the contract and for which there are existing contract unit prices .
num advertisement the public advertisement inviting bids for the construction of specific num projects .
num amount bid the amount bid for a particular item of work in a proposal .
num article a primary numbered subdivision of a section of the standard specifications .
num award the decision of the department of transportation to accept the bid of the lowest num responsible responsive bidder for work that is subject to the furnishing of payment and num performance bonds and such other conditions as may be otherwise provided by law the num proposal and these specifications .
num base course that portion of the pavement structure of planned thickness placed num immediately below the pavement or surface course .
num bid or proposal paper bid the offer of a bidder on the proposal furnished by the num department to perform the work and to furnish the labor and materials at the prices quoted .
num section num num electronic bid the electronic offer of a bidder via bid express to the department to num perform the work and to furnish the labor and materials at the prices quoted .
num bid bond or bid deposit the security furnished by the bidder with his bid as num guaranty that he will furnish the required bonds and execute such documents as may be num required if his bid is accepted .
num bidder an individual partnership firm corporation llc or joint venture formally num submitting a bid for the work contemplated .
num board or board of transportation the board created by the provisions of num ncgs numbnum for formulating policies for the department of transportation and num awarding all transportation construction contracts .
num bridge a structure including supports erected over a depression or an obstruction such as num water highway or railway and having a track or passage way for carrying traffic or other num moving loads and having a length measured along the center of the roadway of more than num num ft between undercopings of end supports spring lines of arches or between extreme ends num of openings for multiple reinforced concrete box structures .
num bridge length the length of a bridge structure is the overall length measured along num the line of survey stationing back to back of backwalls of abutments if present otherwise end num to end of the bridge floor .
num bridge width the clear width measured at right angles to the longitudinal centerline of num the bridge between the bottom of curbs guard timbers or face of parapets or in the case of num multiple heights of curbs between the bottoms of the lower risers .
num calendar day a day shown on the calendar beginning and ending at midnight .
num chief engineer the chief engineer division of highways north carolina num department of transportation acting directly or through his duly authorized representatives .
num completion date that date established as set forth in the contract or as revised by num authorized extensions by which it is required that the work set forth in the contract be num satisfactorily completed .
when observation periods are required by the specifications they num are not a part of the work to be completed by the completion date or intermediate contract num times stated in the contract unless otherwise noted .
num construction easement a right owned by the department of transportation in num a parcel of land owned by a third party outside the highway right of way for containing num construction that exceeds the right of way .
num contract the executed agreement between the department and the successful bidder num covering the performance of and compensation for the work .
num the term contract is all inclusive with reference to all written and electronic agreements num affecting a contractual relationship and all documents referred to therein .
the contract shall num include but not be limited to the proposal the printed contract form and attachments num contract bonds plans standard specifications and supplemental specifications standard num special provisions and project special provisions contained in the proposal and all executed num supplemental agreements .
all references to contracts shall include electronic agreements and num printed paper agreements .
these may include but not be limited to the electronic bid bond num noncollusion certification debarment certification gift ban certification and award num limits .
num the contract shall constitute one instrument .
num contract item a specifically described unit of work for which a unit or lump sum num price is provided in the contract .
synonymous with pay item .
num section num num contract lump sum price the amount bid for a lump sum item that has been num submitted by the contractor in his proposal .
num contract payment bond a bond furnished by the contractor and his corporate num surety securing the payment of those furnishing labor materials and supplies for the num construction of the project .
num contract performance bond a bond furnished by the contractor and his num corporate surety guaranteeing the performance of the contract .
num contract time the number of calendar days inclusive between the date of availability num and the completion date said dates being established as set forth in the special provisions num including authorized extensions to the completion date .
num contract unit price the unit bid price for a unit item that has been submitted by num the contractor in his proposal .
num contractor the successful bidder to whom the contract has been awarded and who num has executed the contract and furnished acceptable contract bonds .
num culvert any structure not classified as a bridge that provides an opening under the num roadway .
num current controlling operation or operations any operation or num operations as determined by the engineer that if delayed would delay the completion of the num project .
num date of availability that date established as set forth in the special provisions by num which it is anticipated that sufficient work sites within the project limits will be available for num the contractor to begin his controlling operations that are not otherwise limited by num moratoriums listed third party conflicts or by weather conditions .
num department or department of transportation a principal department num of the executive branch that performs the functions of planning design construction and num maintenance of an integrated statewide transportation system .
num division of highways the division of the department of transportation that under num the direction of the secretary of transportation carries out state highway planning design num construction and maintenance functions assigned to the department of transportation .
num drainage easement a right owned by the department of transportation in a parcel num of land owned by a third party outside the highway right of way to construct and maintain num ditches channels or structures for directing the course and flow of water outside the highway num right of way .
num easement a property right to use or control real property of another .
num engineer the chief engineer of the north carolina department of transportation num acting directly or through a duly authorized representative such representative acting within num the scope of particular assigned duties or authority .
num equipment all machinery and equipment together with the necessary supplies tools num and apparatus for upkeep and maintenance all of which are necessary for the proper num construction and acceptable completion of the work .
num extra work work found necessary or desirable to fully complete the work as num contemplated in the contract for which payment is not provided for by the contract unit or num lump sum prices in the original contract .
extra work shall not be work that in the terms of the num contract is incidental to work for which there is a contract price or work that payment is num included in some other contract unit or lump sum price .
num section num num final acceptance date that date on which all work set forth in the contract and num work modified by the engineer is satisfactorily completed excluding any observation periods num not specifically made a part of the work by the specifications or special provisions .
num final estimate the document that contains a final statement of all quantities and total num dollar amount for each item of work performed during the life of the contract including any num adjustments to those amounts made under the terms of the contract .
the final statement will num be titled the final estimate and will be the document used to document final payment to the num contractor .
receipt of this document by the contractor will begin the time frame for filing of num a verified claim with the department as provided for in ncgs num .
num final estimate assembly as constructed plans and other project records that num establish the final statement of quantities to be paid and document work performed on the num project .
num force account notice a written notice to the contractor that extra work ordered num by the engineer will be paid as force account work .
num force account work work that is paid in accordance with article num or on the num basis of the force account formula provided in the contract .
num highway a general term denoting a public way for purposes of vehicular travel num including the entire area within the right of way .
synonymous with road and street .
num hour one of the num equal parts of a day .
num inspector the authorized representative of the engineer assigned to make a detailed num inspection of any or all portions of the work and materials .
num intermediate completion date that date established as set forth in the special num provisions or as revised by authorized extensions by which date it is required that the portion num of work set forth in the contract be satisfactorily completed .
num intermediate completion time the time established as set forth in the special num provisions or as revised by authorized extensions by which it is required that the portion of num work set forth in the contract be satisfactorily completed .
num intermediate contract time days the number of calendar days inclusive num between the date of availability and the intermediate completion date said days being num established as set forth in the special provisions or as revised by authorized extensions by num which it is required that a portion of that work set forth in the contract be satisfactorily num completed .
num intermediate contract time hours the number of hours inclusive num between the time of availability and the intermediate completion time said times being num established as set forth in the special provisions including authorized extensions to the num intermediate completion time .
num invert the lowest point in the internal cross section of a pipe or other culvert .
num invitation to bid the notification that bids will be received for the construction of num specific projects .
num laboratory the testing laboratory of the department of transportation or any other num testing laboratory that may be designated or approved by the engineer .
num local traffic traffic that must use the facility under construction to reach its num destination .
num major and minor contract items major contract items are listed as such in num the project special provisions .
all other original contract items and extra work shall be num considered as minor items .
num section num num materials any substances that may be incorporated into the construction of the project .
num median the center section of a divided highway that separates the traffic lanes in one num direction from the traffic lanes in the opposite direction .
num mobilization the work described in article num .
num pavement structure the combination of base and surface courses placed on num a subgrade to support the traffic load and distribute it to the roadbed .
num pay item synonymous with contract item .
num plans the approved plans profiles typical roadway sections appropriate standard num drawings supplemental plans and working drawings or exact reproductions thereof that num show the location dimensions and details of the work to be done and that are a part of the num contract .
num prebid conference a conference held before bids are accepted on a project at which num representatives of the department will provide information and accept and answer questions num from interested parties .
num project the work specified under the contract .
num project special provisions special provisions peculiar to the project and not num otherwise thoroughly or appropriately set forth in the standard specifications or plans .
num proposal the electronic or paper document provided by the department that the bidder num uses to develop his electronic or paper offer to perform the work at designated bid prices .
num purchase order bidder a bidder that can bid on any department purchase order num contract or division let contract .
num right of way the land area shown in the plans as right of way to be furnished by the num department of transportation within which the project is to be constructed .
num road synonymous with highway and street .
num roadbed the graded portion of a highway usually considered as the area between the num intersections of top and side slopes upon which the base course surface course shoulders and num medians are constructed .
num roadside a general term denoting the area within the limits of the right of way adjoining num the outer edge of the roadway .
extensive areas between the roadways of a divided highway num may be considered roadside .
num roadway the portion of a highway within limits of construction .
num section a numbered chapter of the standard specifications .
num shoulder the portion of the roadway adjacent to the traveled way for accommodation num of stopped vehicles for emergency use and for lateral support of base and surface courses .
num sidewalk that portion of the roadway primarily constructed for pedestrian traffic .
num skew angle the angle between the centerline of the project and the centerline of a pipe num culvert bridge pier bent abutment or other drainage feature measured to the right of the num project centerline facing in the direction of progressing stations .
num special provisions project special provisions and standard special provisions taken num together as one body of special provisions .
num specifications the general term comprising all the directions provisions and num requirements contained or referred to in the standard specifications including the num supplemental specifications together with such additional directions provisions and num requirements that may be added or adopted as special provisions .
num section num num standard drawings the general term comprising all the directions provisions and num requirements contained or referred to in the book entitled roadway standard drawings and in num any subsequent revisions or additions to such book that are issued as detail drawings .
num standard special provisions special directions or requirements not otherwise num thoroughly or appropriately set forth in the standard specifications and that are peculiar to num a selected group of projects .
num standard specifications the general term comprising all the directions num provisions and requirements contained or referred to in this book entitled standard num specifications for roads and structures and in any subsequent revisions or additions to such num book that are issued as supplemental specifications .
num state the state of north carolina .
num station a station when used as a term of measurement will be num linear feet measured num horizontally .
when used as a location it will be a designated point on the project .
num street synonymous with highway and road .
num subcontractor an individual partnership firm joint venture llc or corporation to num whom the contractor with the written consent of the engineer sublets any part of the num contract .
num subgrade that portion of the roadbed prepared as a foundation for the pavement num structure including curb and gutter .
on portions of projects that do not include the num construction of a base course or pavement the presence of the subgrade will not be num recognized during the life of such contract .
num substructure all of that part of the structure below the bearings of simple and num continuous spans spans skew back of arches and tops of footings of rigid frames together num with the backwalls and wingwalls .
num successful bidder the bidder awarded a contract .
num superintendent the representative of the contractor authorized to supervise and num direct the construction for the contractor and to receive and fulfill directions from the num engineer .
num superstructure all of the part of the structure exclusive of the substructure .
num supplemental agreement a written agreement between the contractor and the num department of transportation covering amendments to the contract .
num supplemental specifications specifications regulations standards manuals or num codes referenced in the contract or general revisions or additions to this book of standard num specifications that are issued under the title of supplemental specifications .
supplemental num specifications shall be considered part of the standard specifications .
num surety a corporate bonding company furnishing the bid bond or furnishing the contract num payment and performance bonds .
num temporary construction easement a temporary right owned by the num department of transportation in a parcel of land owned by a third party outside the highway num right of way for the use of the department of transportation during the construction and that num reverts to the third party on completion of construction .
num through traffic traffic that can reach its destination by a route or routes other than num the facility under construction .
num time of availability that time established as set forth in the special provisions by num which it is anticipated that sufficient work sites within the project limits will be available for num the contractor to begin his controlling operations .
num section num num total amount bid same as total price bid .
the total amount bid will be considered num to be the correct sum total obtained by adding together the amounts bid for every item in the num proposal other than items that are authorized alternates to those items for which an amount bid num has been established .
num unbalanced bid a bid that includes any unbalanced bid price .
num unbalanced bid price a unit or lump sum bid price that does not reflect reasonable num actual costs that the bidder anticipates for the performance of the item in question along with num a reasonable proportionate share of the bidders anticipated profit overhead costs and other num indirect costs .
num work work shall mean the furnishing of all labor materials equipment and incidentals num necessary or convenient to the successful completion of the project or any part portion or num phase thereof and the carrying out of all duties and obligations imposed by the contract .
num working drawings stress sheets shop drawings erection drawings falsework num drawings cofferdam drawings catalog cuts or any other supplementary drawings or similar num data that the contractor is required to submit to the engineer for review or approval .
num section num num bidding requirements and conditions num num invitation to bid num after the advertisement has been made an invitation to bid will be made available on the num departments website to interested parties informing them that bids will be received for the num construction of specific projects .
such invitations will indicate the contract identification num number length locations and descriptions a general summary of the items and approximate num quantities of work to be performed and the time and place for the public opening and reading num of the bids received .
information concerning the cost and availability of plans and proposals num will be indicated in the invitation to bid .
num all projects will be advertised in daily newspapers throughout the state before the bid num opening .
num num contractor prequalification num contractors desiring to perform work on department projects shall prequalify with the num department .
upon prequalification contractors will be placed on the departments num prequalified contractors list on the directory of transportation firms .
the requirements for num prequalification are as follows num a bidder prequalification num num applicant shall submit a completed bidder experience questionnaire along with any num additional supporting information requested by the department as noted in the num experience questionnaire package .
additional requirements for prequalification may num be set forth in the bid proposal .
num num applicant shall demonstrate that he has sufficient ability and experience in related num transportation construction projects to perform the work specified in the num departments contracts including the type and dollar value of previous contracts .
num num applicant shall demonstrate a history of successful performance and completion of num projects in a timely manner subject to contract time adjustments .
num num applicant shall demonstrate the financial ability to furnish bonds as specified in num ncgs numanum and any other relevant statutes .
num num applicant shall demonstrate sufficient and readily available equipment to perform num transportation construction contracts in a timely manner .
num section num num num applicant shall demonstrate sufficient available experienced personnel to perform num transportation construction contracts .
the identities and qualifications of both num management and labor work force shall be provided .
num num applicant shall provide names and addresses of persons for whom the firm has num performed related work .
responses from the references shall be on department num forms and shall be received by the department before evaluating the request for num prequalification .
num num applicant shall provide any information requested concerning the corporate and num operational management structure of the company the identity of persons or entities num owning stock or other equity interest in the company and the relationship between num the applicant and any other company prequalified or applying for prequalification num with the department .
num num applicant shall demonstrate at the time of application for prequalification the num financial capacity to successfully complete projects containing the work types they num so designate .
num num applicant shall provide further information as may be required to determine that the num firm is a responsible bidder .
num num applicant shall submit a completed prebid noncollusion certification debarment num certification and gift ban certification in accordance with article num .
these num forms can be found on the departments website .
num num applicant shall submit a completed safety index rating form with the questionnaire num and annually thereafter in accordance with subarticle numd .
num bidders shall renew annually and shall requalify every num years in accordance with num subarticle nume .
num the bidder experience questionnaire shall be completed in its entirety and signed by num an officer of the firm .
the officers signature shall be notarized .
in addition to num submitting the bidder experience questionnaire the prospective bidder shall submit num supporting information in a format of his choosing to address the requirements listed num above .
num it is recommended that the prospective bidder file all required statements and documents num with the state contractual services engineer no less than num weeks before a given letting .
num a bid shall not be opened unless all prequalification requirements have been met by the num bidder and have been found acceptable by the engineer .
num b purchase order bidder prequalification num contractors who have been approved to be placed on the prequalified bidders list as num noted above may perform work for the department as a purchase order bidder and need num not apply further .
however purchase order bidders will not be placed on the num prequalified bidders list unless they submit through the prequalification process num described above .
num num applicant shall submit a completed department purchase order bidder application num along with any additional supporting information requested by the department as num noted in the application .
additional requirements for prequalification may be in the num bid proposal .

num num the mistake in the bid is of a clerical or mathematical nature and not one of bad num judgment carelessness in inspecting the work site or in reading the contract .
num section num num num the mistake is found to be made in good faith and was not deliberate or by reason of num gross negligence .
num num the amount of the error or mistake is equal to or greater than num of the total amount num bid .
num num the notice of mistake and request for withdrawal of the bid by reason of the mistake num is communicated to the engineer within num hours after the scheduled time of bid num opening .
upon proper notification of a mistake and request for withdrawal of bid num the bidder shall submit within num hours written notice of mistake accompanied by num copies of bid preparation information to the engineer .
the notification of a mistake num request for withdrawal of bid and copies of bid preparation information shall be num submitted to the state contract officer or engineer .
num num the department will not be prejudiced or damaged except for the loss of the bid .

the bidder shall be required to present num a written affidavit that the documents presented are the original unaltered documents num used in the preparation of the bid .

num num value engineering proposal num this value engineering specification is to provide an incentive to the contractor to initiate num develop and present to the department for consideration any cost reduction proposals num conceived by him involving changes to the contract .
this specification does not apply unless num the proposal submitted is specifically identified by the contractor as being presented for num consideration as a value engineering proposal vep .
submittals that propose material num substitutions of permanent features such as but not limited to changes from rigid to flexible num or flexible to rigid pavements concrete to steel or steel to concrete bridges will not be num considered acceptable veps .
depending on the complexity of evaluation and num implementations veps that provide for a total savings before distribution of less than num num may not be considered .
num a types of proposals num veps contemplated are those that would result in a net savings to the department by num providing a decrease in the total cost of construction or reduce the construction time num without increasing the cost to construct the project .
the effects the vep may have on the num following items but not limited to these items will be considered by the department num when evaluating the vep num num service life num num safety num num reliability num num economy of operation num num ease of maintenance num num desired aesthetics num num design num num standardized features and num num environmental impact .
num b evaluation of proposals num the department reserves the right to reject the vep or deduct from the savings identified num in the vep to compensate for any adverse effects to these items that may result from num implementation of the vep .
num the department reserves the right to reject at its discretion any vep submitted that num would require additional right of way .
substitution of another design alternate detailed in num the contract plans for the one that the contractor bid will not be allowed .
plan errors that num are identified by the contractor and that result in a cost reduction will not qualify for num submittal as a vep .

num no time extension will be granted due to the time required to review a vep .

num b water method num keep the concrete continuously wet by the application of water through soaker hoses or num another approved method for a minimum period of num curing days after placing the num concrete .
num when using cotton mats rugs carpets earth blankets or sand blankets to retain the num moisture keep the entire surface of the concrete damp by applying water with a nozzle that num so atomizes the flow that a mist and not a spray is formed until the surface of the concrete num is covered with the curing medium .
do not apply the moisture from the nozzle under num pressure directly upon the concrete and do not allow it to accumulate on the concrete in a num quantity sufficient to cause a flow or wash the surface .
at the expiration of the curing num period clear the concrete surfaces of all curing mediums .

num at the time of use thoroughly mix the compound with the pigment uniformly dispersed num throughout the vehicle .

num item section asphalt binder numb asphalt primer numa tar numc woven cotton fabric numd num method a waterproofing num a general num method a waterproofing consists of one coat of asphalt primer and num mop coats of hot num asphalt cement with num layers of cotton fabric alternating between the mop coats .
num section num num b preparation of surface num ensure that concrete surfaces are dry reasonably smooth and free from projections or holes num which are capable of puncturing the membrane .
immediately before applying the num waterproofing thoroughly clean the surface of dust and loose materials .
num make sure that the concrete is at least num days old for class a concrete at least num days old num for class aa concrete or at least num days old for high early strength concrete before num beginning waterproofing .
do not waterproof in wet weather nor when the temperature is num below numf without permission .
num c application num give waterproofed surfaces a thorough coat of asphalt primer and allow it to set thoroughly num before applying the first mop coat .
heat the asphalt cement for the mop coat to a num temperature of at least numf and frequently stir to avoid local overheating .
equip the num heating kettles with thermometers .
num begin the waterproofing at the low point of the surface .
num use a half width first strip of fabric and a full width second strip .
lap the full width of num the first strip .
make the third and each succeeding strip full width and lap so there are num num layers of fabric at all points with laps at least num inches wide .
make sure that the end laps num are at least num inches .
num beginning at the low point of the surface mop a section about num inches wide and the full num length of the surface with hot asphalt cement .
immediately roll the first strip of fabric into num the asphalt cement and press into place to eliminate all air bubbles and to provide a firm num bond to the surface .
mop this strip and an adjacent section of the surface of a width equal num to slightly more than half the width of the fabric with hot asphalt binder and roll a full num width of the fabric into this cement completely covering the first strip and press into place .
num mop this second strip and an adjacent section of the concrete surface with hot asphalt num cement and place the third strip of fabric to lap the first strip at least num inches .
continue num this process until the entire surface is covered each strip of fabric lapping at least num inches num over the second preceding strip .
give the entire surface a final mopping of hot asphalt num cement .
num mop on concrete to completely cover the surface sufficiently heavy on cloth to completely num conceal the weave .
use at least num gallons of asphalt on horizontal surfaces for each num num square feet of finished work and at least num gallons on vertical surfaces .
perform the num work so at the close of a days work all laid cloth receives the final mopping of asphalt .
num thoroughly seal down all laps .
num d special requirements num at the edges of the membrane and at any points punctured by such appurtenances as drains num or pipes make suitable provisions to prevent water from getting between the waterproofing num and the waterproofed surface .
num place all membrane flashing at curbs and against girders spandrel walls etc .
with separate num sheets of membrane lapping the main membrane at least num inches .
closely seal flashing num with either a metal counterflashing or by embedding the upper edges of the flashing in a num groove poured full of joint filler .
num provide expansion joints both horizontal and vertical with water stops and premolded num joint filler as called for in the plans .
seal expansion joints in the face adjacent to the num membrane bituminous material .
carry the membrane continuously across all expansion num joints .
num at the ends of the structure carry the membrane well down on the abutments and make num suitable provisions for all movement .
num section num num e repairs num repair any damage that occurs as directed .
repair by patching when permitted .
extend num the first ply of the patch at least num inches beyond the outermost damaged portion of the num membrane and extend the second ply at least num inches beyond the first .
num f backfilling num do not backfill without permission and until the final mop coat thoroughly hardens .
place num backfill so the waterproofing is not damaged .
num num method b damp proofing num a general num method b dampproofing consists of num coats of tar grade rt num .
num b preparation of surface num make sure the surfaces are dry .
immediately before applying the first dampproofing coat num thoroughly clean the surfaces of dust and loose materials .
permit the concrete to cure for num at least num days for class a concrete at least num days for class aa concrete or num days for num high early strength concrete before dampproofing .

apply the tar with suitable num brushes to secure uniform and thorough applications .

num num two consecutive failing lots except on resurfacing num num three consecutive failing lots on resurfacing or num num two consecutive failing density gauge control strips .

if the contractor fails to achieve satisfactory density after two control strips have num been attempted cease production of that mix type until such time as the cause of the num failing density test results can be determined .

num num compaction num immediately after the asphalt mixture has been spread struck off and surface and edge num irregularities adjusted thoroughly and uniformly compact the pavement .
compact the mix to num the required degree of compaction for the type of mixture being placed .
num provide sufficient number and weight of rollers except as noted to compact the mixture to num the required density while it is still in a workable condition .

where uniform density is not being num obtained throughout the depth of the layer of material being tested change the type andor num weight of the compaction equipment as necessary to achieve uniform density even though num such equipment has been previously approved .
num compact all final wearing surfaces except ogfc using a minimum of two steelwheel num tandem rollers unless otherwise approved .
pneumatictire rollers with two tandem axles and num smooth tread tires may be used for intermediate rolling .
num limit rolling for ogfc to one coverage with a tandem steelwheel roller weighing a num maximum of num tons with additional rolling limited to one coverage with the roller where num necessary to improve the riding surface .
num steelwheel tandem vibratory rollers specifically designed for the compaction of asphalt num pavements may be used on all layers num inch or greater in thickness during the breakdown and num intermediate rolling phase .
do not operate vibratory rollers in the vibratory mode during the num finish rolling phase on any mix type or pavement course ogfc or on padc .
num when vibratory rollers are used use rollers that have variable amplitude and frequency num capabilities and that are designed specifically for asphalt pavement compaction .
provide num rollers equipped with controls that automatically disengage the vibration mechanism before num the roller stops when being used in the vibratory mode .
num the engineer may prohibit or restrict the use of vibratory rollers where damage to the num pavement being placed the underlying pavement structure drainage structures utilities or num other facilities is likely to occur or is evident .
num do not use rolling equipment that results in excessive crushing of the aggregate or excessive num displacement of the mixture .
num in areas inaccessible to standard rolling equipment thoroughly compact the mixture by the num use of hand tampers hand operated mechanical tampers small rollers or other approved num methods .
num use rollers that are in good condition and capable of being reversed without backlash to num compact the mixture .
operate rollers with the drive wheels nearest the paver and at uniform num speeds slow enough to avoid displacement of the mixture .
equip steelwheel rollers with num wetting devices that will prevent the mixture from sticking to the roller wheels .
num begin compaction of the material immediately after the material is spread and shaped to the num required width and depth .
carry out compaction in such a manner as to obtain uniform num density over the entire section .
perform compaction rolling at the maximum temperature at num which the mix will support the rollers without moving horizontally .
complete the compaction num including both intermediate rolling before the mixture cooling below a workable num temperature .
perform finish rolling to remove roller marks resulting from the compaction num rolling operations .

num item section hot applied joint sealer num num construction methods num install the sealant so that it forms a complete watertight bond with a high degree of elasticity num with maximum flexibility and longevity under extreme temperature ranges .
num clean cracks and joints using a hot compressed air lance to blast out any vegetation dirt num dampness and loose materials from the cracks and joints .
equip the air compressor with num suitable traps and filters to remove moisture and oil from the compressed air .
use the hot air num lance to dry and warm the adjacent pavement immediately before sealing .
direct flame dryers num are not allowed .
num section num num heat and apply the sealant material according to the manufacturers recommendations .
use num a portable melting kettle for heating the material that is equipped with indirect heating num airjacketed flow and is capable of constantly agitating the joint sealer to maintain a uniform num temperature .
equip the kettle with either mechanically operated paddles andor a continuous num circulating pump to maintain agitation .
use heating equipment capable of controlling the num sealant material temperature within the manufacturers recommended temperature range and num that is thermostaticallycontrol calibrated between numf to numf .
locate a thermometer on num the kettle so the engineer can safely check the temperature of the sealant material .
num overheating of the sealant material will not be permitted .
num apply sealant in the prepared cracks and joints within the manufacturers recommended num temperature range using a pressure screed shoe to completely fill the crack or joint leaving num a sealed num inch overband .
excessive overbanding or waste of sealant materials will not be num tolerated .
immediately squeegee the crack seal material to minimize the height of the num overband .
all sealed cracks and joints shall have a minimum of num inch depth of sealant num installed .
num do not apply the hot applied joint sealer when the surface temperature of the pavement is num below numf .
follow manufacturers recommendations .
num after the crack or joint has been sealed promptly remove any surplus sealer on the pavement .
num do not permit traffic over the sealed cracks and joints without approval by the engineer .
num when approved by the engineer place sand or other approved material over the crack or joint num to prevent tracking .

a num inch to num inch wide num strip of pavement surface shall be protected from tining for the length of and centered about num longitudinal joints .
num the tining operation shall be done so that the desired surface texture will be achieved while num minimizing displacement of the larger aggregate particles and before the surface permanently num sets .

num num seed num the quality of all seed and all operations in connection with the furnishing of this material num shall comply with the north carolina seed law and with the rules and regulations adopted num by the north carolina board of agriculture and consumer services in accordance with said num law in effect at the time of sampling and with the quality requirements of the standard num specifications .

supplementary num testing for seed germination may be performed by the engineer .
num the quality of all seed will be based on the percentage of pure live seed which will be num computed by multiplying the percentage of purity by the percentage of germination and num dividing the result by num .
num seed shall have been approved by the north carolina department of agriculture and num consumer services before being sown .
no seed will be accepted with a date of test more than num eight months before the date of sowing excluding the month in which the test was completed .
num such testing however will not relieve the contractor from responsibility for furnishing and num sowing seed that meets these standard specifications at the time of sowing .
the engineer num may retest seed for germination after num months of storage at the beginning of each normal num seeding season for the particular kind of seed involved or at any time that the condition of the num seed appears to have deteriorated .
num when a low percentage of germination causes the quality of the seed to fall below the num minimum pure live seed specified the contractor may elect subject to the approval of the num engineer to increase the rate of application sufficiently to obtain the minimum pure live seed num content specified provided that such an increase in the rate of application does not cause the num quantity of noxious weed seed per acre or square yard as the case may be to exceed the num quantity that would be allowable at the regular rate of application .
num furnish and deliver each of the species or varieties of seed in separate bags .
if seed is to be num mixed before sowing perform such mixing in a commercial seed mixing machine or by num an equally thorough means after sampling and testing have been completed .
num during handling and storing care for the seed in such a manner that it will be protected from num damage by heat moisture rodents or other causes .

num during wet weather allow the sod to dry sufficiently before lifting to prevent tearing during num handling and placing .
during extremely dry weather water it before lifting if such watering num is necessary to insure its vitality and to prevent loss of soil during handling .

num g welded structural shapes num produce butt welds of flanges and webs and fillet welds of web to flanges of plate num girders and haunched beams using the submerged arc process .
produce other structural num shapes built up from plates and bars using the submerged arc process unless another num process is qualified for these joints in accordance with the bridge welding code and is num subject to the approval of the engineer .
num after all shop welded splices in the flanges and webs for the full length of the field num section are made tested and approved fit the flange plates tight and square against the num web to leave no gap and to not bow the web .
brace one side of each flange against the num web with gussets or struts and tack weld securely to the web at the stiffener locations .
num upon removal of the welds grind any nicks or gouges preheat weld and test or num incorporate into the stiffener fillet weld .
num connect the flanges to the web by starting the fillet weld at one end of the girder and num proceeding to the other ends .
num as an option make adjacent welds simultaneously .
num the sequence for making the flange to web fillet welds is subject only to the provisions num for control of shrinkage and distortion and to the position requirements of the bridge num welding code .
num after flange to web welds are complete shift bracing gussets or struts if necessary then num remove all temporary gussets or struts .
remove tack welds by grinding flush with parent num metal .
num straighten any transverse warpage of the flanges if necessary by heating along the num centerline of the outside face .
num fit tight square and tack weld stiffeners securely to the web .
with the girder in the flat num position web horizontal weld the stiffeners to the web .
do not weld or tack weld num stiffeners to the flanges except where noted in the plans .
stiffeners are not to be used to num correct tilt of flange due to distortion associated to welding .
num after all parts are welded into place trim the girder to detail length with adjustments for num slope and end rotation exceeding num inch nett .

num num curing concrete num a general num cure concrete by steam curing radiant heat curing or water curing as set forth below .
num as an option cure concrete for prestressed piles with membrane curing compound as set num forth below .
use a method or methods that prevent the concrete from losing moisture at num any time before curing is complete .
use methods that do not deface or injure the num concrete .
use curing procedures that prevent cracks from occurring in the members .
num cure all members in any one bed by the same method .
num continue the curing period until the concrete reaches sufficient strength to permit transfer num of load from the anchorage to the members .
as soon as the concrete attains release num strength immediately release all forms in a continuous operation without delay for other num activities such as the cleaning of forms .
immediately following the removal of the forms num detension the members .
num b curing at elevated temperatures num perform radiant heat curing under a suitable enclosure that contains the heat and prevent num moisture loss .
apply moisture by a cover of moist burlap cotton matting or similar num approved material .
retain moisture by covering the member with an approved waterproof num sheeting in combination with an insulating cover .
support the cover at a sufficient num distance above the member being cured to allow circulation of the heat .
num provide steam curing enclosures essentially free of steam leakage to minimize moisture num and heat losses .
do not allow the enclosure to come in contact with the members or num forms for the members .
do not direct steam jets on the forms so as to cause localized num high temperatures .
num after placing and vibrating allow the concrete to attain its initial set before the num application of heat or steam .
the concrete is considered to obtain its initial set when it num has a penetration resistance of at least num psi when tested in accordance with num aashto t num .
take the sample of concrete tested for penetration resistance from the num last load cast in the bed .
store the sample of concrete with the precast member and num maintain in the same condition and environment as the member except for the periods of num time necessary to prepare the test specimen and to perform the penetration resistance test .
num conduct the penetration resistance test .

num num transfer of load num a producer quality control representative or equivalent qualified personnel shall be present num during removal of forms and during transfer of load .

num when curing at elevated temperatures begin the procedures for transferring prestressing load num immediately after curing is discontinued and the forms are released and while the concrete is num still hot to prevent cooling shrinkage and cracking .

num section num num transfer load to not cause cracks in members .
transfer load by gradual release of the strands num as a group by gradual release of part of the group or by burning the fully tensioned strands at num the ends of the members .
if intending to release the strands by a method other than gradual num release of the entire group submit six copies of the proposed method and pattern of release if num not so shown in the plans for approval .
rigidly follow the approved method and pattern of num release .
when the fully tensioned strands are burned burn each strand or group of strands num simultaneously at each end of the bed in its indicated order in the pattern and at each end of num each member before proceeding to the strands in the next group in the pattern at any point .
num because of the critical nature of the bond development length in prestressed concrete panel num construction if transferring of stress by burning the fully tensioned strands at the ends of the num member burn each strand first at the ends of the bed and then at each end of each member num before proceeding to the next strand in the burning pattern .
num when detensioning all girders box beams cored slabs piles and panels do not burn strands num quickly but heat with a low oxygen flame played along the strand for at least num inches until the num metal gradually loses its strength .
apply heat at such a rate that failure of the first wire in num each strand does not occur until at least num seconds after heat is first applied .
when num detensioning other members follow the above procedure unless an alternate procedure is num approved .
detensioning by arc welder is not allowed .
num incorporate the following in the method for single strand detensioning of members having num draped strands num a release the pair of straight strands located in the uppermost position in the lower flange num first .
num b then release the tension in the draped strands at the ends and uplift points in accordance num with an approved pattern .
num c disengage all holddown devices for draped strands and release the holddowns .
num d then release the pair of straight strands located in the upper flange .
num e release the remaining straight strands of the pattern in accordance with an approved num sequence .
num f release all strands in a manner meeting the engineers approval that will cause num a minimum shock and lateral eccentricity of loading .
num failure to follow the above procedures for transfer of load is ground for rejection of the num members involved .
num num vertical cracks in prestressed concrete girders before num detensioning num this section addresses prestressed concrete members that have vertical casting cracks before num strand detensioning .
certain types of these cracks have been determined by the department to num render the girders unacceptable .
num unacceptable cracked members are those with two or more vertical cracks spaced at a num distance less than the member depth which extend into the bottom flange .
such members are num not serviceable and will be rejected .
members with two or more vertical cracks spaced at a num distance less than the member depth but do not extend into the bottom flange are subject to num an engineering assessment .
such members may not be serviceable and may be rejected .
num members with one or more vertical cracks that extend into the bottom flange and are spaced num at a distance greater than the member depth are subject to an engineering assessment to num determine their acceptability .
if this engineering assessment is required submit at no num additional cost to the department a proposal for repairing the member and a structural num evaluation of the member prepared by an engineer licensed by the state of north carolina .
num section num num in the structural evaluation consider the stresses under full service loads had the member not num cracked and the effects of localized loss of prestress at the crack as determined by methods num acceptable to the department .
num all members except those defined as unacceptable which exhibit vertical cracks before num detensioning shall receive a num day water cure as directed by the engineer .
the water cure num shall begin within num hours after detensioning the prestressing strands and shall be at least num num feet beyond the region exhibiting vertical cracks .
num the department has the final determination regarding acceptability of any members in num question .

num section num num epoxy and adhesives num num epoxy resin systems num a classification num the types of epoxies and their uses are as shown below num type num a lowmodulus nonsag gel adhesive used to bond or repair damp vertical or num overhead surfaces .

num type num a lowmodulus generalpurpose adhesive used in epoxy mortar repairs .

num type num a highmodulus generalpurpose adhesive used to bond plastic concrete or num hardened concrete to hardened concrete or other structural materials .

it may be used for num anchoring bolts where a flowable adhesive is required .

num h notes on use of epoxies num num safety num epoxies can irritate the eyes skin and respiratory tract .

num num mixing num stir parts a and b individually until each component is homogeneous .
use a separate num stirrer for each component .
num combine parts a and b either by weight or volume as specified in the num manufacturers instructions .
stir the mixture vigorously periodically scraping the num sides and bottom of the container .
small quantities of epoxy usually require num to num num minutes to mix homogeneously numgallon quantities can take up to num minutes of num mixing .
num temperature affects the viscosity and pot life of epoxies .
most laboratory tests are num conducted at numf .
higher temperatures render epoxies thinner and faster setting num lower temperatures induce higher viscosities and longer pot lives .
num add sand or other fillers to liquid epoxies only after parts a and b have been num thoroughly mixed .
stir in the sand or filler until all particles are completely coated .

num when applying epoxy to a cold substrate preheat the components approximately numf num above numf for every numf of substrate temperature below numf .
num seal previously opened containers to be airtight .
unsealed containers can absorb num moisture from the atmosphere which can alter the chemical reaction of the mixture .

the solution temperature num is maintained at numf to numf with this carbon dioxide flow for at least num minutes num and until the trichloroethylene vapors have been completely removed from the num distillation flask .

num during project construction perform an insulation resistance test on each feeder circuit num conductor .
the insulation resistance for each conductor shall exceed num megaohms after num charging for num seconds at num vac or num vdc .
the contractor meg circuit data form is num available on the department website .
submit the data form to the engineer for review before num final inspection .
num if the insulation resistance test of any conductor indicates a value of less than num megaohms num locate the fault .
if the fault is in a conductor between terminal connections replace the num conductor .
if the fault is at a terminal connection repair or replace the terminal device .
num removing water from the conduit of a faulty circuit is not considered a repair .
water in the num conduit allows electric current to flow between skinned places in the conductors insulation .
num if a circuit fails the insulation resistance test and removing water allows the circuit to pass num replace the conductors and retest the new circuit .

num section num num place sod firmly and carefully by hand within num hours after soil preparation is completed num and accepted by the engineer .

close unavoidable num gaps with small pieces of sod .
num when placing sod on a slope begin at either the top or the toe of the slope .
place sod num with the long edge horizontal and with staggered vertical joints .
turn the edge of the sod num slightly into the ground at the top of a slope and place a layer of earth over it and compact num so as to divert the surface water over and onto the top of the sod .
num stake sod in place by driving stakes flush with the sod on all slopes num or steeper in num drainage channels on other areas shown in the plans and on any areas that are in such num condition that there is danger of sod slipping .
perform staking concurrently with sod num placement and before tamping with sound wooden stakes which are approximately one num inch square or one inch in diameter and not less than num inches in length .
place enough num stakes to prevent slipping or displacement of the sod .
drive stakes perpendicular to the num slope .
where backfill is necessary on cut slopes to obtain a uniform sodding area num provide stakes of sufficient length to reach at least num inches into the solid earth num underneath the backfill .
num on all other areas use metal staples in place of wooden stakes .
the metal staples should num be num inches long made of num gauge new steel wire so as not to bend when pinned or num driven through the sod .
shorter staples may be used with the approval of the engineer .
num place stake and staple the sod where necessary then tamp or roll carefully and firmly by num acceptable means .
if rolled roller shall weigh num lbs .
per foot of roller width .
take num extreme care to prevent the installed sod from being torn or displaced .
